meanings.definition: A container made of wood or plastic used for transporting or storing goods.
meanings.sent1: The farmer loaded the ripe fruits into the crates.
meanings.sent2: The delivery truck was filled with crates of fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat jumped in and out of the empty crates, pretending they were a fortress.
meanings.sent4: The crates lined up in the warehouse like soldiers ready for duty.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the crates being stacked echoed through the storage room.

meanings.definition: To pack or store in crates.
meanings.sent1: The workers will crates the fragile items carefully for shipping.
meanings.sent2: She decided to crates all the books neatly on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: He tried to crates his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day crates themselves in the corner of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The chef will crates the fresh produce to keep them organized.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Greece.
meanings.sent1: In Greece, you can buy many things with just a few crates.
meanings.sent2: The traveler exchanged their euros for Greek crates at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The children played with fake crates, pretending they were rich merchants.
meanings.sent4: His hard work paid off, and soon he had crates to spare.
meanings.sent5: The value of the crates fluctuated with the market changes.
